Deployments: Objects that define a desired state for a group of pods, and can be used to deploy and manage applications in a Kubernetes cluster.

Tweet:
3. Security misconfigurations & Default configs

Kubernetes is highly complex, offering tons of controls & configs.

The default configs are NOT designed to be secure.

For eg. pods don't have network policies by default. They freely exchange info, which is bad for security.

Kubernetes lets you audit activity in your environment & generate logs.

Use an open source threat detection engine like Falco to analyze the data & identify suspicious activity.

- Limit requests to create/modify/delete objects in containers

- Keep Kubernetes up-to-date
